Given a set of points, returns a vector containing the coefficients a and b of y=a*ln(x)+b, the natural logarithmic function which best fits the set of points, given as the elements in two lists.
Given a set of points, returns a vector containing the coefficients a and b of y=a*ln(x)+b, the natural logarithmic function which best fits the set of points, given as the rows of a matrix.
Given a real number a and an integer b, returns the logarithm of a in the base b.
Returns [y,y',C,y'max,xmax,R] where y is a logistic function (solution of y'/y=a*y+b), such that y(x0)=y0 and where [y'(x0),y'(x0+1)…] is the best approximation of L.
Given an expression, returns a list of the functions of the expression which utilize variables, including occurrences of the variables themselves.
Given an expression, a matrix, and an integer n, multiplies row n of the matrix by the expression.
There are two uses for this function, whose second argument is always a mapping of a variable onto an expression.
There are two uses for this function, whose second argument is always a mapping of a variable onto an expression.
Returns a list containing the elements of the given matrix.
Calculates the n power of a matrix by use of the Jordan normal form.
Returns the l∞ norm (the maximum of the absolute values of the coordinates) of a matrix.
Returns the l∞ norm (the maximum of the absolute values of the coordinates) of a vector.
Returns the arithmetic mean of a list (with an optional list as a list of weights).
Returns the arithmetic mean of the columns of the matrix.
Returns the median of a list or vector (with an optional list as a list of weights).
Returns the medians of the columns of the matrix.

Given three points that define a triangle, draws the median of the triangle that passes through the first point and contains the midpoint of the segment defined by the other two points. In CAS view, returns the equation of the median line.

Given a list and an element, returns the index of the first occurrence of the element in the list. If the element does not appear in the list, returns 0. Similar to contains, except that the element comes first in the argument order.

Given a vector and an element, returns the index of the first occurrence of the element in the vector. If the element does not appear in the vector, returns 0. Similar to contains, except that the element comes first in the argument order.
Returns the midpoint of a segment, given two points that define a segment. The segment need not actually be drawn.
Returns the midpoint of a segment.
Returns the matrix of an isometry given by its proper elements.
Uses the modular algorithm to return the greatest common divisor of two polynomials.

If the given complex expression has a complex denominator, returns the expression after both the numerator and the denominator have been multiplied by the complex conjugate of the denominator. If the given complex expression does not have a complex denominator, returns the expression after both the numerator and the denominator have been multiplied by the complex conjugate of the numerator.

Takes an expression in which the numerator or the denominator contains a square root. If the denominator contains a square root, returns the expression after both the numerator and the denominator have been multiplied by the conjugate of the denominator. If the denominator does not contain a square root, returns the expression after both the numerator and the denominator have been multiplied by the conjugate of the numerator.

Given an expression, a variable of differentiation, and a real number h, returns an approximate value of the derivative of the expression, using f’(x)=(f(x+h)–f(x+h))/(2*h). Without a third argument, the value of h is set to 0.001.

Given an expression, a variable of differentiation, and an expression with that variable in place of h, returns an approximate value of the derivative of the expression, using f’(x)=(f(x+h)–f(x+h))/(2*h).
Negative binomial probability density function. Computes the probability density of the negative binomial distribution at x given parameters n and k.
Cumulative negative binomial distribution function. Returns the lower-tail probability of the negative binomial probability density function for the value x, given parameters n and k.
Inverse cumulative negative binomial distribution function. Returns the value x such that the negative binomial lower-tail probability of x, given parameters n and k, is p.
Uses Newton's method to estimate the root of a function, beginning with Guess and calculating Integer iterations. By default, Integer is 20.
Returns the smallest prime number greater than the argument.
Returns the expanded irreducible form of an expression.

Given a complex number, returns it divided by its modulus. It is also an option for plotfield. In this case, the term comes last in the set of arguments and the result is the slopefield segments are given equal length.
Given a vector, returns it divided by its l2 norm (where the l2 norm is the square root of the sum of the squares of the vector’s coordinates).
For integers a and b, returns the numerator of the fraction a/b after simplification.
Returns 1 if the given integer is odd, otherwise returns 0.

Ordinary Differential Equation solver. Solves an ordinary differential equation given by Expr, with variables declared in VectVar and initial conditions for those variables declared in VectInit. For example, odesolve(f(t,y),[t,y],[t0,y0],t1) returns the approximate solution of y'=f(t,y) for the variables t and y with initial conditions t=t0 and y=y0.
Connects a set of points with line segments, in the given order, to produce a polygon. If the last point is the same as the first point, then the polygon is closed.
Connects a set of points with line segments, in the given order, to produce a polygon. If the last point is not the same as the first point, then the polygon is open.
Returns the remainder (O term) of a series expansion: limit(x^a*order_size(x),x=0)=0 if a>0
Returns the ordinate of a point.
Returns the y-length of a vector.

Returns the orthocenter of a triangle; that is, the intersection of the three altitudes of a triangle. The argument can be either the name of a triangle or three non-collinear points that define a triangle. In the latter case, the triangle does not need to be drawn.

Returns the orthocenter of a triangle; that is, the intersection of the three altitudes of a triangle. The argument can be either the name of a triangle or three non-collinear points that define a triangle. In the latter case, the triangle does not need to be drawn.
orthogonal(A,line(B,C)) draws the orthogonal plane of line BC through point A.
orthogonal(A,line(B,C)) draws the orthogonal plane of line BC through point A.
Takes a prime integer n congruent to 1 modulo 4 and returns [a,b] such that a²+b²=n.
Returns the Pade approximation of an expression; that is, a rational fraction P/Q such that P/Q=Expr mod x^(n+1) or mod n with degree<p.
Draws a parabola, given a focus point and a directrix line, or the vertex of the parabola and a real number that represents the focal length
Draws a parabola, given a focus point and a directrix line.
Draws a parabola, given the vertex of the parabola and a real number that represents the focal length
Given a point and a line, returns the equation of the line through the point that is parallel to the given line.

Draws a parallelogram given three of its vertices. The fourth point is calculated automatically but is not defined symbolically. As with most of the other polygon commands, you can store the fourth point’s coordinates into a CAS variable. The orientation of the parallelogram is counterclockwise from the first point.
Returns a parametric equation for a geometric object. The parametric equation is true for all complex numbers that represent points on the object.
Returns the nth sub expression of an expression.
Performs partial fraction decomposition on a fraction.
Given a list or vector containing the roots of a polynomial, returns a vector containing the coefficients (in decreasing order) of the univariate polynomial having those roots.
Given a list or vector containing the roots of a polynomial, returns a vector containing the coefficients (in decreasing order) of the univariate polynomial having those roots.
Used in Symbolic view of the Geometry app. Displays the circumference of a circle. The measure is displayed, with a label, at the given point in Plot view.
Used in Symbolic view of the Geometry app. Displays the perimeter of a polygon. The measure is displayed, with a label, at the given point in Plot view.
Draws the perpendicular bisector of a segment, defined by its two endpoints.
Draws the perpendicular bisector of a segment, defined by its name.
Plots the graph of the solution of inequations with two variables.

Used in the Geometry app Symbolic view. Takes a complex expression in one variable and an interval for that variable as arguments. Interprets the complex expression f(t)+i*g(t) as x=f(t) and y=g(t) and plots the parametric equation over the interval specified in the second argument.
Used in the Geometry app to draw a polar graph in Plot view.
Used in the Geometry app to draw a polar graph in Plot view.

Used in the Geometry app Symbolic view. Given an expression in x and a list containing three values, draws the line y=x, the plot of the function defined by the expression over the domain defined by the interval between the last two values, and draws the cobweb plot for the first n terms of the sequence defined recursively by the expression (starting at the first value).
Creates a point, given the coordinates of the point. Each coordinate may be a value or an expression involving variables or measurements on other objects in the geometric construction.
Creates a point, given the coordinates of the point. Each coordinate may be a value or an expression involving variables or measurements on other objects in the geometric construction.

Randomly re-distributes a set of points such that, for each point, x is in the interval [-5, 5] and y is in the interval [-5, 5]. Any further movement of one of the points will randomly re-distribute all of the points.
Returns the polar line of the given point as pole with respect to the given circle.
Returns the polar line of the given point as pole with respect to the given circle.
Returns a vector containing the polar coordinates of a point.
Given the radius and angle of a point in polar form, returns the point with rectangular coordinates in complex form.
Returns the pole of the given line with respect to the given circle.

Used in the Geometry app Symbolic view. Given an n × m matrix, draws and connects the points (xk, yk), where xk is the element in row k and column 1, and yk is the element in row k and column j (with j fixed for k=1 to n rows). Thus, each column pairing generates its own figure, resulting in m–1 figures.

Used in the Geometry app Symbolic view. Given an n × m matrix, draws and connects the points (xk, yk), where xk is the element in row k and column 1, and yk is the element in row k and column j (with j fixed for k=1 to n rows). Thus, each column pairing generates its own figure, resulting in m-–1 figures.
Given a set of points defined by two lists, and a positive integer n, returns a vector containing the coefficients of the nth order polynomial which best approximates the given points.
Given a set of points defined by a matrix, and a positive integer n, returns a vector containing the coefficients of the nth order polynomial which best approximates the given points.
Returns a function whose gradient is the vector field defined by a vector and a vector of variables.
Given a set of points defined by two lists, returns a vector containing the coefficients m and b of y=b*x^m, the monomial which best approximates the given points.
Given a set of points defined by a matrix, returns a vector containing the coefficients m and b of y=b*x^m, the monomial which best approximates the given points.
Given a set of points defined by two vectors, returns a vector containing the coefficients m and b of y=b*x^m, the monomial which best approximates the given points.
Given a circle and a point, returns the difference between the square of the distance from the point to the circle’s center and the square of the circle’s radius.
Adds an element to the beginning of a list.
Adds an element to the beginning of a vector.
Returns a polynomial divided by the greatest common divisor of its coefficients.

With an expression as the first argument, returns the product of solutions when the variable in the expression goes from a minimum value to a maximum value by a given step. If no step is provided, it is taken as 1.
With a list as the first argument, returns the product of the values in the list.
With a matrix as the first argument, returns the element-by-element product of the matrix.
Returns a fraction or rational fraction A/B simplified to Q+R/B with R<B (or with the degree of R less than the degree of B).
Returns a fraction or rational fraction A/B simplified to Q+R/B with R<B (or with the degree of R less than the degree of B).
Given a polynomial P and a value a, returns the Taylor polynomial Q such as P(x)=Q(x-a)
Unassigns a variable name in CAS view. For example, if f is defined, then purge(f) deletes that definition and returns f to its symbolic state.
Given a quadratic form and a vector of variables, returns the symmetric matrix of the quadratic form with respect to the given variables.
Given a list, and a quantile value between 0 and 1, returns the corresponding quantile of the elements of the list.
Given a vector, and a quantile value between 0 and 1, returns the corresponding quantile of the elements of the vector.
Given a list, returns the first quartile of the elements of the list.
Given a matrix, returns the first quartile of the elements of the columns of the matrix.
Given a vector, returns the first quartile of the elements of the vector.
Given a list, returns the third quartile of the elements of the list.
Given a matrix, returns the third quartile of the columns of the matrix.
Given a vector, returns the third quartile of the elements of the list or vector.
Returns a matrix containing the minimum, first quartile, median, third quartile, and maximum of the elements of a list.
Returns a matrix containing the minimum, first quartile, median, third quartile, and maximum of the elements of the columns of the matrix.
Returns a matrix containing the minimum, first quartile, median, third quartile, and maximum of the elements of a vector.
Returns the Euclidean quotient and remainder of the quotient of 2 polynomials, each expressed in symbolic form directly.
Returns the Euclidean quotient and remainder of the quotient of 2 polynomials, each expressed as a vector of coefficients, returning a similar vector of the quotient and a vector of the remainder.
Returns the line whose points all have the same powerpc values for the two given circles.
Returns a random integer with binomial distribution given n trials, each with a probability of success of p.
Returns a random number with χ² distribution given n degrees of freedom.
Given a positive real number, returns a random real according to an exponential distribution with real a>0.
Returns a random number with F distribution given numerator n and denominator d degrees of freedom.
Returns a random integer with geometric distribution given given probability p.
Returns a random real number from the normal distribution N(mu, sigma).
Given a positive integer, returns a random permutation of [0,1,2,…,n–1].
Returns a random integer with Poisson distribution given k.
Returns a random number with Student’s t distribution given n degrees of freedom.

Returns a vector of size n or a n*m matrix that contains random integers in the range - 99 through 99 with uniform distribution or contains random numbers in a given interval or according to the given Distribution.
Rewrites an expression as an irreducible rational fraction.

Given a circle and a vector of objects that are either points or lines, returns a vector where each point is replaced with its polar line and each line is replaced with its pole, with respect to the circle.
Given a vector containing the polar coordinates of a point, returns a vector containing the rectangular coordinates of the point.

Takes a conic expression and returns a vector with the following items: The origin of the conic, The matrix of a basis in which the conic is reduced, 0 or 1 (0 if the conic is degenerate), The reduced equation of the conic, A vector of the conic’s parametric equations
Performs Gaussian reduction of a matrix.
Given a vector or list, removes the values that make Test true and returns the resulting vector or list.
Given a vector or list, removes the occurrences of Value and returns the resulting vector or list.
Given an expression and a vector of variables, reorders the variables in the expression according to the order given in the vector.
Returns the residue of an expression at a value.
Returns the resultant (the determinant of the Sylvester matrix) of two polynomials.
Reverses the order of the elements in a list.
Reverses the order of the elements in a vector.

Used in the Geometry app. Draws a rhombus, given two points and an angle. As with many of the other polygon commands, you can specify optional CAS variable names for storing the coordinates of the other two vertices as points.
Uses Romberg’s method to return the approximate value of a definite integral.
Given a matrix and an integer n, returns the row n of the matrix.
Given a matrix and an interval, returns a vector containing the rows of the matrix indicated by the interval.
Given a matrix and two integers, returns the matrix obtained from the given matrix after the row indicated by the second integer is replaced by the sum of the rows indicated by the two integers.
Returns the number of rows of a matrix
Finds the maximum value (over all rows of the matrix) for the sums of the absolute values of all elements in a row.
Given a matrix and two integers, returns the matrix obtained from the given matrix after swapping the two rows indicated by the two integers.
Reduced Row-Echelon Form. Changes a rectangular matrix to its reduced row-echelon form.
Reduced Row-Echelon Form. Changes a rectangular matrix to its reduced row-echelon form.
Given an expression defining a recurrence relation, a variable, and an initial condition, returns the closed form solution (if possible) of the recurrent sequence.
Given three lists, each containing multiple items of an expression defining a recurrence relation, a variable, and an initial condition, solves the system of recurrent sequences.
Given a test expression in a single variable and a list, tests each element in the list or vector and returns a list containing the elements that satisfy the test.
Given a test expression in a single variable and a vector, tests each element in the list or vector and returns a vector containing the elements that satisfy the test.
Given an expression and an integer n, returns a list with the expression repeated n times.
Given an expression and a variable defined over an interval, returns a vector containing the sequence obtained when the expression is evaluated within the given interval using a step of 1.

Given an expression, a variable defined over an interval, and a step value, returns a vector containing the sequence obtained when the expression is evaluated within the given interval using the given step.

Similar to rsolve. Given an expression defining a recurrence relation in terms of n and/or the previous term (x), followed by a vector of variables and an initial condition for x (the 0th term), returns the closed form solution (if possible) for the recurrent sequence.

Similar to rsolve. Given three lists, each containing multiple items of an expression defining a recurrence relation in terms of n and/or the previous term (x), followed by a vector of variables and an initial condition for x (the 0th term), solves the system of recurrent sequences.
Given an integer and a second integer n, performs a bitwise shift on the first integer; the shift is left if n>0 and right if n<0.
Given a list, shifts the elements of the list 1 place to the left. Elements leaving the list from one side are replaced by 0 on the other side.
Given a list and an integer n, shifts the elements of the list n places to the left if n>0 or to the right if n<0. Elements leaving the list from one side are replaced by 0 on the other side.
Given a vector, shifts the elements of the vector 1 place to the left. Elements leaving the vector from one side are replaced by 0 on the other side.
Given a vector and an integer n, shifts the elements of the vector n places to the left if n>0 or to the right if n<0. Elements leaving the vector from one side are replaced by 0 on the other side.
Returns the result of applying a phase shift of π/2 to a trigonometric expression.
Returns the signature of a permutation given as a vector.

Returns the solution to a system of linear equations or several systems of linear equations presented in matrix form. In the case of one system of linear equations, takes a matrix of coefficients and a column matrix of constants, and returns the column matrix of the solution.
Returns an expression with the complex exponentials rewritten in terms of sine and cosine.

Returns the intersection of Curve1 and Curve2 that is closest to Point. In Plot view, this command will prompt for two curves. After that, a point will appear; move this point to the intersection desired and press Enter. You can move the point later to change intersections if you wish.
Given a line, returns the slope of the line.
Given two points that define a line, returns the slope of the line.
Used in Symbolic view of the Geometry app. Displays the slope of a line. The measure is displayed, with a label, at the given point in Plot view.
Used in Symbolic view of the Geometry app. Displays the slope of a ray. The measure is displayed, with a label, at the given point in Plot view.
Used in Symbolic view of the Geometry app. Displays the slope of a segment. The measure is displayed, with a label, at the given point in Plot view.

Sorts a list of a sequence of objects. If the list or sequence contains numbers, then sorting is done in increasing order. If the list or sequence contains expressions, then the sorting is done in increasing order of numerical values, sums, and products, in increasing exponential order.

Sorts a list of a sequence of objects. If the list or sequence contains numbers, then sorting is done in increasing order. If the list or sequence contains expressions, then the sorting is done in increasing order of numerical values, sums, and products, in increasing exponential order.

Given two lists (one for the x-values and one for the y-values), as well as a variable and an integer degree, returns the natural spline through the points given by the two lists. The polynomials in the spline are in terms of the given variable and are of the given degree.

Given two vectors (one for the x-values and one for the y-values), as well as a variable and an integer degree, returns the natural spline through the points given by the two vectors. The polynomials in the spline are in terms of the given variable and are of the given degree.
Returns a polynomial factorized as a product of powers of coprime factors where each factor has roots of multiplicity 1
Returns the square root of Expr
Returns the standard deviation of the elements of a list. The optional second list is a list of weights.
Returns the standard deviation of the elements of a list of the standard deviations of the columns of a matrix.
Returns the standard deviation of the elements of a vector. The optional second list is a list of weights.
Returns the population standard deviation of the elements of a list. The optional second list is a list of weights.
Returns the population standard deviation of a list of the population standard deviations of the columns of a matrix.
Returns the population standard deviation of the elements of a vector. The optional second list is a list of weights.
Stores the object given as first argument in the variable given as second argument.
Returns the Sturm sequence corresponding to a polynomial.
Returns the Sturm sequence corresponding to the number of sign changes of a polynomial for the variable in the interval (a,b].
Returns the Sturm sequence corresponding to a polynomial.
Returns the Sturm sequence corresponding to a rational fraction.

Extracts from a matrix a sub matrix whose diagonal is defined by four integers. The first two integers define the row and column of the first element and the last two integers define the row and column of the last element of the sub matrix.
Given a list and a counting number n, deletes the nth element in the list and returns the result.
Given an expression and an integer n, returns the expression raised to the power 1/n.
Returns the Sylvester matrix of two polynomials
Defines an array where the index are strings or real numbers
Given a list, returns a vector with the first element deleted.
Given a sequence of objects, returns a vector with the first element deleted.
Given a string, returns a vector with the first element deleted.
Given a vector, returns a vector with the first element deleted.
Returns an expression with tan(x) rewritten as (1–cos(2*x))/sin(2*x).
Returns an expression with tan(x) rewritten as sin(2*x)/(1+cos(2*x)).
Transposes a matrix (without conjugation).
Given a list of values, returns the list truncated to 0 decimal places. This command accepts complex numbers as well.
Given a list of values, as well as an integer n, returns the list truncated to n decimal places. This command accepts complex numbers as well.
Given a value, returns the value truncated to 0 decimal places. This command accepts complex numbers as well.
Given a value, as well as an integer n, returns the value truncated to n decimal places. This command accepts complex numbers as well.
Given a polynomial and an integer n, truncates the polynomial at order n.
Returns an expression with transcendental rewritten as complex exponentials
Returns the function defined by an expression and a variable.
Uniform probability density function. Computes the probability density of the uniform distribution at x given parameters a and b.
Cumulative uniform distribution function. Returns the lower-tail probability of the uniform probability density function for the value x, given parameters a and b.
Inverse cumulative uniform distribution function. Returns the value x such that the uniform lower-tail probability of x, given parameters a and b, is p.
Returns the valuation (degree of the term of lowest degree) of a polynomial, performed for x.
Returns the valuation (degree of the term of lowest degree) of a polynomial, performed for the given variable.
Returns the variance of a list. The optional second list is a list of weights.
Returns the variance of the list of variances of the columns of a matrix.
Defines a vector from the origin to the given point.
Defines the vector from the first point to the second.
Returns a vector containing the list of the vertices of a polygon.
Returns a vector containing the closed list of the vertices of a polygon.
Given a vector V and a vector of variables, returns the vector U such that curl(U)=V.
Weibull probability density function. Computes the probability density of the Weibull distribution at x given parameters k, n and t. By default, t is 0.
Cumulative Weibull distribution function. Returns the lower-tail probability of the Weibull probability density function for the value x, given parameters k, n and t. By default, t is 0.
Inverse cumulative Weibull distribution function. Returns the value x such that the Weibull lower-tail probability of x, given parameters k, n and t
If condition is true, returns Expr1; otherwise, returns Expr2.

Applies a bivariate function to the elements of two lists and returns the results in a vector. Without the default value the length of the vector is the minimum of the lengths of the two lists; with the default value, the shorter list is padded with the default value.

Applies a bivariate function to the elements of two vectors and returns the results in a vector. Without the default value the length of the vector is the minimum of the lengths of the two vectors; with the default value, the shorter list is padded with the default value.
Returns the Z transform of a sequence.
